alert.note: Alert for Martin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 12 at 7:19PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN FARIBAULT AND EASTERN MARTIN COUNTIES... At 719 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles southeast of Fairmont, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Winnebago around 740 PM CDT. Delavan around 745 PM CDT. Minnesota Lake around 755 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Huntley, East Chain, Imogene, Granada and Guckeen. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Minnesota. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
